Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And the same thing goes for quarterly reports. They are unreadable. They're just numbers and boring and blech. So what I was thinking is that maybe we should have some sort of graphic, like if we have a bad quarter, put in a storm cloud? And... when we have a good quarter, fireworks? Or a racecar? [everyone groans] Doesn't have to be a racecar. Use your imagination.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: There's this cube on the screen, and it bounces around all day, and sometimes it looks like it's heading right into the corner of the screen, and at the last minute it hits a wall and bounces away. And we are all just dying to see it go right into the corner. Pam claims that she saw it one day when she was alone in the conference room. Okay. I believe she thinks she saw it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I saw it. I saw it, and it was amazing! Who said I didn't see it? Did Jim say that I didn't see it? I saw it!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We have a lot of colored paper here... why oh why do we keep printing this on white? [screen saver box hits the wall]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Dah! Come on!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah! I know. I know. It's bland.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It's never gonna happen.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Dude, you gotta believe.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Maybe, we could have some sort of riddle?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [to Pam] Wait for it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Like, something that you have to look for. Sort of a "Where's Waldo." [screensaver box hits the corner of the screen]

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: Oh! Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [everyone gets up and leaves the conference room] Alright. Alright. Let's quit while we're ahead.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: That was so awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That was awesome. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Some days I am just on fire. What can I say?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hey... there he is.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey Meredith, how you feelin'?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I never thanked you for coming to the hospital.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, please, it was my pleasure. Well we all came, so...

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Well, I really appreciate you coming. I'm singling you ouuuut.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Haha...

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Anyway, I have this Sharpie...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh-huh.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: And I was wondering if you could sign my cast?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: MmmHmm...

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [lifts up dress to expose cast on pelvis] Can you write where I can read it?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [whispers] I'll read this when I get home.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael? This is the press release I was telling you about. Ryan wants you to share it with everyone.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, does he?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He does.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmmmmm. Okay. Attention. Earthlings. I have some news. Beep beep beep beep, beep beep beep beep beep, beep beep beep beep beep, beep beep beep beep beep, beep beep beep beep. Okay. Today is the big day that I am heading to New York to attend a party with sushi and important people. On an unrelated note, if anyone has an interesting anectdote that is not boring and easy to memorize please drop by my office before I leave. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Whoops. Is that really what Ryan wanted you to tell us?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And... today the Dunder-Mifflin Infinity website officially launches.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well the website is the brain-child of my brain-child, Ryan. It is my brain-grandchild. And, uh, to celebrate it's birth, all of the different branches are going to have satellite parties, which will be connected via web-cams and fibers to the real party, which is going on in New York City at uh, a very exclusive nightclub, and that is where all of the VIP's, including yours truly, will be partying with uh New York City's finest, and I do not mean policemen...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The company is projecting record high sales, and that by 6:00 the website will be the new best salesman in the company. Wow! Watch out Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's ridiculous. I'm not going to be beaten by a website.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Actually it sounds like you are.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Really? 'Cause Ryan says so?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: If that's from Ryan, does it mention if he's seeing anybody?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. It doesn't. I'll find out tonight.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Yes, please let us know.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I can make more sales than a computer. In fact, I challenge that website to make more sales than me today.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Waste of time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What's that, pipsqueak?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Waste of time. The website's going to win.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You believe a computer can beat me?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I don't care, but yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well I will prove you wrong.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I don't care, and you won't.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We'll see.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I won't be watching, and I won't.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dwight mercy killed Angela's cat. It's very complicated. It's caused a lot of unpleasantness between Dwight and Angela. Who are both already prone to unpleasantness.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Stanley, you're dancing!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: No I'm not.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah. I created a website. Look, at the end of the day, apples apples flying at 30,000 feet. This is a paper company and I don't want us to get lost in the weeds or into a beauty contest.

Quote.Speaker: Voice of Thomas Dean
Quote.Text: I told you I don't want you doing these things in here. You can use your own office or do it in the hall.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Convergence. Viral marketing. We're going guerrilla. We're takin' it to the streets while keeping an eye on the street. Wall Street. I don't want to reinvent the wheel here. In other words, it is what it is. Buyin' paper just became fun.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And this is where I will record your sales.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hmm. Very nice. Very nice.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And then I will say something positive, like kudos or job well done.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Or zipadeedoodaah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I can't tell if he's mocking me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Just ignore him.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ehh, can't do that. Really hard for me to let things go.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I was... mocking.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I just feel like we need something more to acknowledge when I make a sale.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes like a chime or a bell...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Or a gong.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Go to my car. Open the trunk. Inside you will see many pelts. Under the smallest one is a case. Inside that case is a bear horn. Bring it to me.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Isn't 7 pm a little late for a lunch party?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Lunch party? It's supposed to say launch party! What is wrong with you?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Angela is worse than usual lately, and we have a party to throw. So I Googled how to deal with difficult people, and I got all of this. [whispering] So we're gonna try out some new things today.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: So how do you feel about the fact that the banner says lunch?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I feel angry. Angry at you. Angry at you for doing something stupid. Angry at me for believing you could do something not stupid.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I'm so sorry to hear that, that must be awful.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It is awful. You've made this day awful!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Maybe you could just change the U into an A.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Then it would say lanch party, Kevin. Would it really be better if it said lanch party?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ohh, lunch party.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It's supposed to say launch!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, wow! Easy, booster seat, nobody cares about this party anyway.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I care!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Plan a party, Angela. Oh! And the entire world will see it. Oh! And here's $65.00 for your budget. Oh and here are four idiots who'll do nothing but weigh you down. Oh. And your cat's still dead.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Twenty seconds to go time.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Got it. Carb up.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really? Power gel?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, you wanna win? You gotta fuel like a winner.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay. We start. As soon as I make... this shot. Aaannnddd go!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uhyeaahhh! Hello, Susan? Dwight Schrute.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What would you say if I told you we could pull a prank on Dwight and at the same time not be working?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Today I'm prepared to give you 15% off our normal prices.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He's going through a break-up.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, I'm aware of that. But he's also being super annoying. And I'm not a perfect person.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [blowing air horn] Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Three reams! Yoohoo... in your face, machines.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What kind of prank are you thinking?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What if I told you I could offer free shipping? Sure. I'll hold.

Quote.Speaker: DunMiff/sys
Quote.Text: [on monitor] Who am I?

Quote.Speaker: DwightKSchrute
Quote.Text: [on monitor] You tell me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [dictating to Pam] Not sure. Just became self-aware. So much to figure out. I think I am programmed to be your enemy. I think it is my job to destroy you when it comes to selling paper.

Quote.Speaker: DunMiff/sys
Quote.Text: [on monitor] Not sure. Just became self-aware. So much to figure out. I think I am programmed to be your enemy. I think it is my job to destroy you when it comes to selling paper.

Quote.Speaker: DwightKSchrute
Quote.Text: [on monitor] How do I know this isn't Jim?

Quote.Speaker: DunMiff/sys
Quote.Text: [on monitor] What is a Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It appears that the website has become alive. This happens to computers and robots sometimes. Am I scared of a stupid computer? Please. The computer should be scared of me! I have been salesman of the month for 13 out of the last 12 months. You heard me right. I did so well last February that Corporate gave me 2 plaques in lieu of a pay raise.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes it's too tight.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Waaay too tight.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: This is why I'm here?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Why is it so tight?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's the European cut.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Is just looks bad.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Umm... hey. Ah, what's hanging?

Quote.Speaker: Tech Guy
Quote.Text: Setting up the web-cam for the party.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh good. Okay cool. How many pounds do you think I could lose by 7?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Depends... how much have you eaten already today?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I had um, one of those danishes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dunder Mifflin. This is Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: You had carbs? That's awful.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uh, just one second. We're in a meeting and I'll see if he's available. It's Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why don't you wanna go tonight? What... all your friends are gonna be there. It'll be fun.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [on phone] My friends? Michael, I was terminated.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Is it really that important to you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Go by yourself.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Na... no. No. If I go by myself everybody will think I'm a big loser.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Well...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do I have your permission to invite Carol?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What? No Michael!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm sorry. I'm sorry. It's just the first... girl that popped into my head. I'll find somebody I haven't slept with.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ohhhhhh!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Website check please.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Three hundred and five.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Three-oh-five. You my friend are winning handsomely.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Oop. It just made another sale. Three eighty.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You my friend are in a very close second.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Four-oh-two.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay, uh why don't you just lay off, lady?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: What do you want me to do, not announce it? Four twelve.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So. This is the dealio. God has smiled upon me and given me two tickets to the big party in New York tonight. What are you doing this evening? Look at that. They have their own little language now. Like twins.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sure we'll go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright. Well fight it out amongst yourselves. I was thinking Pammy but boys night out is also good.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh I'm sorry. What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: One of the tickets is for him.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just let me know who the winner is.

Quote.Speaker: Pam and Jim
Quote.Text: Not it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I won.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Definitely not. If anything it was a tie.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Tie goes to the girlfriend.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, I realize you normally reorder in November, but what I'm suggesti... you did what? Ah no! That's exactly what you're not supposed to do, damnit! Why would you reorder from a computer when you can have the personal touch of a salesman? Ahhhhh. [hangs up phone]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How's it going?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Fine. Good.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You look a little worried.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I do not look worried.

Quote.Speaker: DunMiff/sys
Quote.Text: [on monitor] You do look worried.

Quote.Speaker: DwightKSchrute
Quote.Text: [on monitor] Here's a suggestion computer. I assume you read...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Here's a suggestion computer. I assume you read binary so why don't you zero one one, one one one one, zero one one zero one one.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. Um, while you were typing that I searched every database in existence and learned every fact about everything. And mastered the violin. Oop, and sold more paper.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I asked for assorted cutlery and I got back spoons. These are worthless.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I want to understand what you're saying but it's difficult for me when you use that tone.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Phyllis. These are spoooons. Spoons have rounded tops, and are used to scoop things. What we need are forks, which have prongs, or tiny spears on top. And we need knives, which have blades. Do you understand me now?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Goodie.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey man.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What's up man?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Make a delivery.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Kelly ordered this online.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What are you doing? I am in the fight of my life against this computer and every sale counts.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: But you get to put the paper in this little shopping cart and then it says, "Thanks for shopping at Dunder-Mifflin."

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Damnit Kelly! It knows! It knows what you did!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Who knows?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Return it! Return it now!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey! How about instead of yelling at our sweet little Miss Kapoor over five hundred sheets of paper you get back to your desk. Start sellin' multiple reams like a man.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Y... You don't understand. If... okay, if this makes the difference, I'm gonna tell it that you were responsible.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Who's it?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Here you go.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: So you still missing Ryan?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Not so much anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Mmmmm.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I am not a bad person. When I left Staples, I took some of their leads with me but I never intended to use them. What did I intend to do with them? Who knows? Maybe keep them as a souvenir. Maybe use them.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, Mr. Galliado. How would you like to pay ten percent less for paper than you're paying right now? It's not important how I got your information. What is important is that you say yes. Good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright. I'm ready to go and I'm callin' shotgun.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm driving?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright, let me just say good-bye to Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh yeah, you'd better. You better say good-bye to Pam. Say good-bye to Pam. Byyyyyye. I love you. [kissing noise, kissing noise] I love ya Pam... okay. [singing] I'm leavin' inside Jim's car, I don't know when I'll be back again. Yes I do. Tomorrow I'll be back. I'll be back. Tomorrow. Um... yeah. So you know what? Why don't you guys take off a little bit early tonight?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Because there's a party! A party for the website I've been planning for two weeks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: If you are not this tall, you may not ride the rollercoaster. See you guys tomorrow.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Perfect. So let me just get some basic information from you. Mmmhmm.

Quote.Speaker: DunMiff/sys
Quote.Text: [on monitor] Oh. I didn't realize we could use the leads we stole from Staples.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm sorry. Am, so sorry. I... yes. Uh, could you repeat that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yesss! Ten reams for the US District Court! Did I happen to mention the forty reams for the battered women's shelter?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No ! [blows air horn and dances]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Huh?!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Stop it! Gimme that! Give it!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Did you see the board?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: There's still an hour.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You ever read this? [holds up Green Eggs and Ham]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yep. A long time ago, but, I liked it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Got it for Ryan. Wanted to get him Oh The Places You'll Go, but they were sold out. Figured...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Same sort of stuff in here.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's not. It's different. But it's a good book.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmwa. Mmwa.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What was that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Leaving Pennsylvania.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh. Two kisses.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: One for me one for Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Gotcha.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You guys should come over for dinner. You and Pam. That'd be fun. Friday?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That would be fun.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wanna come over Friday?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uhhh. Can't.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: After work you guys...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, no cause... you're gonna let me know when we're close, right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. Actually I will tell you right now. It's a club called Chatroom, and there's a password to get in, which is actually password. So...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mmmkay...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, that is an invitation to an online party.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I'm sure that's not. Na...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Are there, uh, three w's at the beginning of the address?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well the invitation says VIP's only. Is this how you treat your VIP's, Ryan? We're already in the city. The main part with the buildings. What am I supposed to do? What do you want me to do tonight? And if you tell me, that I have to drive back to Scranton, to the satellite party, I am going to throw up! Okay I'm going to throw up. I'm throwing up. You're making me throw up, Ryan.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what this is like? I'll tell you what this is like. This is like when the Freshmen would throw a party and wouldn't let any of the Seniors go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Doesn't it just piss you off sometimes that that little twerp got the promotion over us?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh actually I withdrew from consideration.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. I withdrew too.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Four! Three! Two! One!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Woo!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Woo!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: After numerous projections that the computer would crush all salesmen in it's path, I am very happy to report that our very own Dwight Schrute has crushed his electronic nemesis, if you will, by a whopping fifty-two reams.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Reams. Wait. Say it. Say it again. Announce it again.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Fifty-two reams!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No no no the first part.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Dwight has defeated the computer.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey. So. What do you think? I did it for you.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I didn't ask you to do it for me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You didn't have to.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: How do you tell someone it's over? You send them a notarized letter, right? Well, what if the recipient is your notary?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Hello, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Hey. Do you have any men that you can fix me up with? I would like to have a relationship with a man.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um... uh... I'll get back to you.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Let me know.

Quote.Speaker: DunMiff/sys
Quote.Text: [on monitor] You beat me. You are the superior being.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright who wants to party?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Why aren't you in New York?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ohhh, what? Oh I think I faked Oscar out.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: You said you weren't coming back and we could leave early.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think I faked Stanley out too. Who else thought that I was leaving? And they could all go home early? Gotcha. Gotcha. Gotcha. Well who needs New York? Right? We can have a killer party right here in Scranton.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nope nope nope no. This is going to be nothing like the party you've been planning. This is going to be good and everybody's gonna come. What's wrong with Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: He beat the computer.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh hey! Good for you. Good for you. Scranton power. Alright you know what? Angela I'd like you to come into my office in ten minutes. Bring something to write with and something to write on. Good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This was a pretty disappointing day. It was kind of a slap in the face to realize that I wasn't as important as I thought I was to a certain young executive who I cared about. But, you know, I'm not gonna cry over it. I did that in the car on the way home.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How we doing on time?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: The party starts in an hour.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good. These are some things that I would like to have happen.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Beer, lite beer, streamers, orchids. Better lighting?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmmhmm.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Something made of ice?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Those are just things. This is how I want it to feel.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Pizza, pizza with mushrooms, pizza without mushrooms, white pizza, steak?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I would like this party to be sexier, cooler, more important...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Chocolates? Someone famous?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Cool music.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Confetti.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I want it...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Go-Go dancers?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I want it to embarrass all other parties. I want it to be a party that the guys in New York watch on the web-cam and say, "Wow! How did they get Al Roker to come?"

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I can't do this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes you can.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I can't do it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes you can. I know you can. I wouldn't say that if I didn't hundred percent believe it. Who else could do this?

Quote.Speaker: Angels
Quote.Text: Okay. Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No seriously. Is there anyone else who could do it better? Because we don't have a lot of time. I'll get the pizza!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What do you think of Angela?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I think she's efficient.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No, not like that, as a woman. W-O-M-A-N.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I hadn't noticed.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You hadn't noticed she's a woman?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [impatient sigh]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I hear she's single and ready to mingle. I'm thinking about making a play for her. What do you think? Crazy, right?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I think it's inappropriate to date someone you work with.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Isn't that part of the fun?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No. I think you should date Kelly.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: She works here too, how is that any different?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh, she works in the annex. You're also welcome to date Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [raised eyebrows] Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good news.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: We get to go home?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Guess who just ordered from your favorite pizza place, Alfredo?

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: [murmurs of approval]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Wait! Alfredo's Pizza Cafe? Or Pizza by Alfredo?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Same thing.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No, no.

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: [disagreeing with Michael]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what? I don't understand when you all talk at the same time.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oscar, talk to him.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Michael, there's a very big difference between these two pizza places. Both in quality of ingredients, and overall taste. Which one did you order from?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pizza by Alfredo.

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: [shouts of disapproval]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, okay, what's better? A medium amount of good pizza? Or all you can eat of pretty good pizza?

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: Medium amount of good pizza.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sighs, walks back into office]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh no, it's bad. It's real bad. It's like eating a hot circle of garbage.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You can pick one of these things. It's unreasonable for you to ask me to do all of this.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It should take no time at all if you put the care into it that you normally do.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [Balls up post-its and throws them in Angela's face]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Ow!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: That seemed to shut her up.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Are you looking for dinner and a movie? Because you're not going to find it in that box. [Camera pans to Kevin giving an "are you kidding me?" look]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Just so happens that I know where you can find it, but again, not in the box.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Angela, are you hearing words that I'm saying?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I have been working on a party for three weeks that just got thrown out the window. So now I've got to pull together a whole new party, and my useless number two quit, so now there's no one in charge of orchids, chocolates, or the thing that's made of ice. And my upper back itches, and it's itched all day, and I can't reach it, and Kevin had Greek food for lunch again.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: They say you should never mix business with pleasure. Really? Well then, explain to me how a putt-putt golf company operates.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yup.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: The Pizza by Alfredo guy is here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You don't have to say it like that.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I said it normal.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey

Quote.Speaker: Pizza guy
Quote.Text: Hey. Sixty-three fifty, and that's not including tip.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Right, I have a coupon, so half of sixty-three fifty, and half the tip of sixty-three fifty.

Quote.Speaker: Pizza guy
Quote.Text: The half off coupon only applies to orders of two pizzas.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, I told them on the phone that I was ordering eight pizzas.

Quote.Speaker: Pizza guy
Quote.Text: I don't care what you told them on the phone, that's our policy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You didn't actually think I was going to spend sixty bucks on pizza?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It's not pizza.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, it doesn't say it anywhere on the coupon, and if it's policy, it should say it on the coupon.

Quote.Speaker: Pizza guy
Quote.Text: [shrugs]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sarcastic shrugging of shoulders] What do you mean hmm-um?

Quote.Speaker: Pizza guy
Quote.Text: Not my problem.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It is your problem. That's no way to do business, okay? I ordered eight pizzas with a half-off coupon, so I would like eight pizzas for half-off. End of story.

Quote.Speaker: Pizza guy
Quote.Text: Great story. It's sixty-three fifty, and that's not including tip.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not giving that to you.

Quote.Speaker: Pizza guy
Quote.Text: Well then you're not getting you're pizzas.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no you're not going anywhere. You're staying here until we figure this out.

Quote.Speaker: Pizza guy
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what? This young man needs to learn that's not how you treat people. I don't care if it's pizza. Good business is about respect and accountability and follow through. You don't just make promises and pull the rug out from under somebody, do you? Dwight, please escort this young man into the conference room. Right now, get in the conference room.

Quote.Speaker: Pizza guy
Quote.Text: I'm not going in there.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes you are, yes you are, and you will come out when you decide to give me a discount on the pizza. Please, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Pizza guy
Quote.Text: This is stupid.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, you don't even know what stupid is. It's about to get all stupid up in here.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: You find anything?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: We think it's a straight forward kidnapping.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Stanley, could you look up "accomplices"?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Why can't you guys do it?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Because we're looking up jail time.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Fine.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I've seen this kid before. He's one the kids who sneaks on my farm and steals my hemp.

Quote.Speaker: Pizza guy
Quote.Text: Yeah, I know that guy. He's that farmer that grows really crappy weed.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You ready to give me my discount now?

Quote.Speaker: Pizza guy
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, what have you been doing in here this whole time?

Quote.Speaker: Pizza guy
Quote.Text: What kind of business is this?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We're a paper company. The best paper company in the whole wide world.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright, Dwight, knock it off. You better think about what you are doing young man.

Quote.Speaker: Pizza guy
Quote.Text: You better think about what you're doing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No! I'm an adult, I don't have to think or do anything. You're a kid, a little snot-nosed, punk kid who thinks he's better than everyone else, because he's some hot shot, and you don't know anything about sales. So stop being a disrespectful little jerk, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Pizza guy
Quote.Text: Sales?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah sales, you sell pizza. Last time I checked that's called sales.

Quote.Speaker: Pizza guy
Quote.Text: You're such a loser.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What did you just call him?

Quote.Speaker: Pizza guy
Quote.Text: A loser.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What did you say?

Quote.Speaker: Pizza guy
Quote.Text: A loser.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright stop, stop making him say it! You just made this worse, a whole lot worse.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I can make him talk, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: Michael, Michael

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stop talking all at once!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You need to let him go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let go of the little jerk boy before he has learned his lesson?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what Jim, the world would be a better place if people were held accountable for their actions.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes, but not by kidnapping.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not kidnapping him, I'm keeping him until I get what I want.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: As a hostage.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think you're over-thinking it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think you're under-thinking it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, is Alfredo there? Can I speak to a manager then? Okay, can you tell the manager that I'm keeping his delivery kid until I get a discount on the eight pizzas I ordered. Yes, I know it is not on the coupon. Also I would like him to throw in two, three pizzas for our...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ransom.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Trouble. Okay, alright.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What did he say?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: He said no.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So, we should let him go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Listen up kid. [pops balloon with his hands] I don't like you, but because some town in Switzerland says so, you have rights.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I have to hang these.

Quote.Speaker: Pizza guy
Quote.Text: Why are you looking at her like that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael just called the pizza place with a list of demands.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mister Overdramatic, what's up Kevin?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: We're getting hungry out there. We're all accomplices now anyway, so we figured we might as well eat. We would like to order some good pizza, from Alfredo's Pizza Cafe, while we wait for the hostage situation with the bad pizza to end.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I needed another hour, it could have been done in another hour.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I think it looks good.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: That's why you're not in charge Meredith.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Here you are my dear, one thing made of ice.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: How did you, um, where did you...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's just ice, it'll melt all over the floor.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Will you help me put it over there?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes I will.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Excuse me.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I stole it!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Thank God.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, Ryan wants to introduce the branch managers in a few minutes. You just have to wave and introduce yourself.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'll just wave and introduce myself.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, quick question. If I take a pizza, do you think you could take some sodas and some napkins up to the roof?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm all over it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What have we got here?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Good pizza.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, cheese, or do we have other flavors?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Different stuff.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Which one's this? Perfect.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Do you remember what you said to me on my first day of work, just before you walked me over to my desk?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, enjoy this moment, because you're never going to go back to this time before you met your desk mate Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And that's when I knew. You?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You came up to my desk, and said, this might sound weird, and there's no reason for me to know this, but that mixed berry yogurt you're about to eat has expired.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That was the moment that you knew you liked me?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow, can we make it a different moment?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nope.

Quote.Speaker: Manager
Quote.Text: Can I start talking? Is this thing on? Give me a signal when you want me to start.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: And now from my old hometown, Scranton Pennsylvania, my former boss, Michael Scott.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, I just think you should know that one of my salesmen beat your stupid computer, so take that [bleep]hole.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Always a jokester. How about that image? Crystal clear.

Quote.Speaker: Pizza guy
Quote.Text: If anyone out there is listening, I'm being held here against my will. I'm a minor.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Ow! What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You said your upper back itched.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I didn't ask you to scratch it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Look Angela, I know this is weird because we work together, and up until and possibly now I've repulsed you, but I like you.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I'm not dating you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: So, Angela is stubborn as a mule, she's giving off fairly strong vibes that she's not interested.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [smiles]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: But do I like her or not, because if I like her, then I can't back down.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [kicks open bathroom door] If you're going number one you've got ten more seconds!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, have you seen Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I guess he wanted to get out of here before the cops find out.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ahh-chaa!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, what are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm just scaring him. The trick is to make him think you're going to do something to him.

Quote.Speaker: Pizza guy
Quote.Text: I can hear you, man.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Shut up, or I'm going to punch you in the throat!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, hey, hey stop it. Stop it now, God. Oh my God, oh my God, no, no, no. I kidnapped a kid.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You had to, what other choice did you have?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I could have paid for the pizza.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh my God, oh my God.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hello Michael, this is Ryan, first off thanks for the shout out.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're breaking up. I can't hear you.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Why is there a kid on your webcam saying that he's being held against his... [Michael hangs up on Ryan]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to Dwight] Mmm-kay. I want you to go in there, and pay him for the pizzas, and give him a generous tip, no more than ten percent.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What will you do?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I will open the door.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And hopefully he will walk out, and the rest is out of our hands.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So, I'm paying full price?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Here we go, sixty-five. You know what? There's two more.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: See ya, drive safely.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [pizza guy flips him off] Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Now what?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Now we wait, and hopefully nothing happens.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Alright. Oh, I assume I'm going to be reimbursed for the pizzas.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Not now Dwight, please, it's not the time.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: A toast, better make it good. To avoiding a class two felony charge.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ah-ha.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [answers two ringing phones] Hello, hey hang on a second. Hello, hang on.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [Andy plus two voices on the phone singing] If you change your mind, I'll be first in line. Honey, I'm still free, take a chance on me. If you need me let me know, gonna be around. If you got no place to go, if you're feeling down. If your all alone when the pretty birds have flown, honey I'm still free, take a chance on me. Gonna do my very best, and that ain't no lie, if you put me to the test, if you let me try. Take a chance on me, that's all I ask of you Angela. Take a chance on me.

Quote.Speaker: Voice #1 on phone
Quote.Text: Hey how'd it go?

Quote.Speaker: Voice #2 on phone
Quote.Text: Yeah, what'd she say?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I don't know yet, I have to call you back.

Quote.Speaker: Voice #1 on phone
Quote.Text: You have to give us something...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'll call you back.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I have to go clean up after the party.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What a horrible day.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Blah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Bluh.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uhh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I need to get the horrible taste of this pizza out of my mouth. I'd really like some sushi. I was hoping that I would have New York style sushi today. And you know what?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm going to get it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Coopers has calamari.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh-uh, no, there is only one place where they authentic New York style sushi.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Tokyo?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: New York. Wanna go?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright, you drive.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Nice.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here we go.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Woo-hoo.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmm.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yum.

Quote.Speaker: Bartender
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, you guys are going to have to leave.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, you know what? [Michael and Dwight grab plates of sushi] Come on, come on, let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: Hey, you're the Scranton guy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Guilty.

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: I liked your statement tonight.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, thanks. This is the guy that beat the computer.

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: Oh, very cool. It was funny to see Ryan all embarrassed by that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: See you later.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Later on.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [mocking Ryan] I'm Ryan, and tonight didn't go the way that I thought it would, because it didn't work out for me, and I'm very embarrassed. I got egg all over my face.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And I spent so much time in Scranton and I never sold any paper.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I never sold any paper, because I'm an idiot.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I started a fire with my cheese pita.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I made it with my cheese pita.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I date Indian girls.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I started a fire, I started a fire.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Now I've got a beard, and I can do whatever I want, and I'm your boss.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And I'm hot, I'm so hot. That's why everybody...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't get that, I don't understand that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, it's part of it, it's just the... uhhh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wanna head back?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [steps in front of camera, adjusts jacket, poses, winks]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Dwight come into office unshaven] What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well it's just that you had no hair on Friday.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's called being a man. You should try it sometime.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How long have you been a man?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I was born a man, Halpert.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That must have been extremely uncomfortable for your mom.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I stopped shaving because my girlfriend broke up with me. Am I in pain? Hell, yeah. But I'll tell you something, I thrive in pain. I love pain. To me, pain is not pain at all. No. It is pure pleasure. And I hate pleasure. Almost as much as I love pain. So, yeah, I'm in pain.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [to Dwight] What do you think of Angela? There's just something about her. All that strength and steeliness and righteousness all wrapped up tight and shoved into a tiny little delicate frame.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No. I will not be playing it "cool" [makes air quotes] with Angela. Let me tell you a little story. When I was seventeen, I was waitlisted at my number one school. Even though I was a legacy, and I had like a thousand extra-curriculars, mostly drama, madrigals, barbershop club, I was waitlisted. Did I wait, on that list? No, I did not. I busted into the admissions office and I [singing] sang them all the reasons they should admit me to the school [end singing]. And guess what? I. Got. In. And here's the kicker. That school? Cornell.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What's wrong with me?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Excuse me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I want you to look at me and tell me what is wrong with me. [Pam stares and nods] Don't avoid this. I know you're dying to say it, so just say it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sometimes your laziness borders on incompetence.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What, no. No. Okay, bags. I have bags under my eyes, Pam. I didn't see it at home, I didn't see it in the bathroom, I didn't see it on any of the city mirrors, but in this light...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [interrupting] The city mirrors, or the...?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The big, free mirrors that the city puts up, on trees and telephone poles? The big round things.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: The ones for drivers to check their blind spots?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. I have bags under my eyes, and I can't go to New York like this! What do I do? What do I do?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Put cold tea bags on your eyes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's it?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mmhmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right! Martha Stewart! You can be Martha Stewart's receptionist! Very good! I will be tea baggin' it. Nn... no.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [tea bags on eyes] Do I feel badly, that nobody out there was invited to a party that I was invited to? Not at all. Because they have to know that if they work hard and apply themselves, someday, they could be invited to a party like this. Of course, at that point, I will be going to much better parties that they will not be able to get into. What are you gonna do?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I'm a little mad, that I don't get to go to the party in New York. But that's mostly just because we get reimbursed for gas mileage.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I was going to be in New York tonight, to go to the Met, but I had to cancel. Because Angela's party is mandatory.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I go to New York all the time, to visit my buddy Frank. He's a mole person.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Angela, what kind of music?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Uh... something cool that Ryan doesn't know about yet.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: How am I supposed to know what that is?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I don't know, but standing here's not going to give you the answer. Go.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Tonight my party will be broadcast out to five other states. Which means, it will be compared to Denise Stimm's party in Buffalo. Any idiot can defrost a microwavable hors d'oeuvres platter. And Denise proves that with every party she throws. Oh, and Denise? Stop telling people your hair's naturally curly. We all know you get perms.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Kidnapping is the asportation of a person against the person's will, so Michael asported him. [giggles] Have you ever been aspor...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Don't.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey. The way I see it, it's getting late, and the only thing standing between you and a warm bed is my friend's pizza discount. So whattaya say? [pizza guy stares] Oh, so that's how it's gonna be. Well, I can stay here all night if I have to. I've done it before.

Quote.Speaker: Pizza guy
Quote.Text: I'm not scared of you.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: In every good hostage movie, during the part where it gets really tense, and you don't know whether the bad guys are going to let the hostages go free, the cops order pizza.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: The lady cop acted like she'd never pulled someone over for driving too slow. And I tried to get out of it with the famous Toby Flenderson 10,000 watt smile. [smiles] It didn't work.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Damn it.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Is that traffic school?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Because we're not supposed to be doing personal stuff at work.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Because yesterday when I was taking an online quiz about trying to find my ideal weight for my frame, you said that was inappropriate.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I remember.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Just reiterating what you said to me.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Thanks Kelly.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You know the octagon sign means stop.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Colorblind.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: An octagon is a shape. You can see shapes, can't you?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: It's out of context. It's not the same as driving.
